documents.document: Knit 1, Purl 1 etc etc So good to have my broken arm healed and functional again.
I've just discovered that, as an administrator of a Facebook page, I can see things other people can't see. What a day!!
With Twitter so overloaded with that ghastly Trump man, cat and kitten photos are starting to look really good.
Sometimes, big changes take a lot of courage.
Early morning dentist, day three.
Reflections, shadows and shapes in the new, Post-earthquake Christchurch https://t.co/GNLuJNmqOJ
Computer back from repair shop & I have the usual exaggerated sense of my own intelligence after getting all the plugs in the right holes.
@ShakingStick Oh yes, I forgot about that one....perhaps intentionally given some of the meals 😊
@ShakingStick Sue is usually brilliant on QI too. Plus she did a great show walking through England. I love her sense of humour
@ShakingStick And Sue! With the glasses. What a treasure!
I so enjoy The Great British Bakeoff...sort of like Antiques Roadshow but with foodstuffs, hot ovens & wry humour.
@Swatchway The shock of returning to work has played havoc with my 'wordsmithery.' 😊
Just lost a thin slither of cucumber in my work keyboard. First day blues.
First day back at work but before that - a one hour dentist appointment! Life's tough.
Going back to work tomorrow is going to seem like light relief after all this Donald Trump garbage.
Something else new taking shape in inner city Christchurch under the cover of 'blue.' https://t.co/uXSvp8a9sU
Post-earthquake construction forging ahead in Christchurch. It's been a long haul since first quakes of September 2… https://t.co/mF0Xv4Wx91
Japanese guy playing the didgeridoo in the mall....and why not?
Last day of freedom (from work), so I'm cruising around city cafes and taking photos.
@sarabeee I think I could dispute that.
Too many cherries. Fruit gluttony.
The fact that it's 25-deg in Christchurch today hasn't stopped me buying a TON of wool! Half price & one thing is certain, it WILL get cold.
Early start in the garden on a peaceful Sunday morning. Cutting kindling for winter. Very satisfying.
@beckeleven I wish I could be so oblivious 😔
Morning coffee (after the morning walk), at Unknown Chapter https://t.co/TQpUVT9se8
Masterchef Australia seems to be turning into a bit of a sob-fest.
Third walk of the day. https://t.co/BQu9lftMSP
The drainage guy thought my sons were my brothers. I call that a win :-)
@rachaelking70 At least you get the chance to have wind in your hair on the back of a horse. I tend not to move that fast.
@rachaelking70 @MonzaGT Early early morning or late evening are the times I aim for........for my token exercise effort that is
@MonzaGT @rachaelking70 It's enough to put you off walking!
Second walk of the day in 29-degree heat. Not my brightest move.
12 hours after they started, Darren & his 16yrold apprentice are still here working. Hope they're not planning a sleepover!
Helpful traidie tip: How long does it take to mix a cubic metre of concrete? Answer: Four beers!
@MonzaGT The word "Cowboys" springs readily to mind! Although the company has redeemed itself by sending this fellow.Guess they want 2B paid
@MonzaGT Shame EQC doesn't believe in the 'Do it once, Do it right' school of tradesmanship.
@MonzaGT Which is why this guy is here - fixing the mess the last two made!
@paulbrislen Sure is. Just a shame the company sent two lazy numpties last week. This guy has worked at 3x their speed fixing their mess.
This new tradesman is amazing and SO good at teaching his 16-year-old apprentice! I'm very impressed.
Fantastic! I have a new team of workmen here to fix all the mistakes the first guys made last week.
Tutto Bene - always money well spent.
"Do you eat bacon? "No, we're the non-bacon and non-ham twins."
@shimmo23 Holiday spirit I think they call it :-)
@King_Soph Me too......that was me trying to be positive about it 😊
Not really a big fan of sand....but here I am sitting on a cool windy beach trying to look comfortable.
New construction, Christchurch https://t.co/f6mh65ZU9J
Endless blue - a day at Sumner Beach. https://t.co/kiWNbsSNRs
What an ignorant prick that man is! https://t.co/EfRA5z8Vyk
I've invited the drainage supervisor around to inspect his team's work. Surely I can't be the only one who is dissatisfied?
Haven't watched TV or read newspapers & barely on Twitter for 5 days. No idea what's happening in the world. Quite like it that way.
@FeyHag New shops one in inner city one in riccarton
We've done the Botanic Gardens, the Museum and two cafes. Now choosing birthday books at Scorpio.
@Magna_Quies Made a pig of myself - predictably!
Successfully sat through "Sing" with the 7-year-olds. 🐵🐒🐶🐕🐩🐺🐎🐴🐷🐄🐃🐂🐮🦄🦁🐗🐏🐑🐪🐷🐖🐴🐎🐫🐅
Just made up a recipe for avocado & banana iceream. It's divine. Pretty damn pleased with myself.
@hariata Eating straight out of your own garden always feels like a win doesn't it :-)
Some of the fattest, juiciest bok choy I've ever grown - picked for dinner. https://t.co/pNND7Hru58
@oharris69 How fantastic!
Sleepless in the Suburbs.
@CherylBernstein SO many ways we could go with that...... I'll be quiet now. :-)
Beach walks, kite watching, swimming, cafes, city cruise, painting stones, puzzles, drawing ....all on today's busy list. Knackered!
@beechworks And they obviously shampoo their bottoms before they deliver :-)
@megingle Umbrellas for sure. Hail!
Have to pick up the Australians at midnight. They're going to get a shock. Hosing down in Christchurch & about 12-degrees.
@JarrodGilbertNZ That's what they all say :-)
@JarrodGilbertNZ Easy come, easy go. We'll never be without computer options but could we survive without our pleasures?
@JarrodGilbertNZ You appear to have a wine glass behind you - use it!
When these EQC drainlayers leave today, it won't be a moment too soon. A complete chapter of accidents from start to finish.
"We've run out of grass seed but you've got half your lawn." "But I want ALL my lawn. You'll just have to go and get some more seed."
@Lukeurmyson But what I *want* is a shotgun!
@Lukeurmyson You need another category for "All of the Above" (It's been that sort of day).
@CherylBernstein I did offer this morning - old school, couldn't help myself. But definitely none of my famous 'tradesmen's date scones.'
@CherylBernstein Total Cowboys. Now complaining about rain & fact they were supposed to be finished yesterday. Whose fault is that I added.
@CherylBernstein EQC has a lot to answer for in this city. Pleased to have pipes fixed after 6years obviously but still want to shout&swear!
@CherylBernstein Took 2hrs to fix and you should see the bum job on concrete. They tell me concrete replacement not part of quote. Furious.
@MargeInovera Thanks D. Can have coffee & with family coming tonight have told them No-one leaves until hot water restored. Cowboys!
More drainage woes. Now the young numpties have cut off my hot water supply and have to call a plumber. Losing my patience now.
I'm free, I'm free - and so far my holiday consists of sitting in the carpark at The Hand Clinic. It can only improve.
One hour until two weeks' leave!
@CherylBernstein @secondzeit "Sods and Tossers."
@Jake_Vig Forget the dog years, here's how you can start playing around with elephant years - https://t.co/tXGBIlmmW5
Came home to find the deck reinstated. That's a huge relief. But let's not talk about the garden just yet - complete with mini bulldozer.
@MonzaGT Especially as it was all their fault. They're the ones who broke the water pipes.
@MonzaGT Finally got rid of them. "And it's only f**king Monday," one of them sighed as he left the property :-)
Have a sudden yearning for a weathered, old tradesman who knows what he's doing - just to repair the damage mind, not for me personally.
"I've never worked this late EVER," says the young drainage guy. 'Well you're not leaving until we have water," I told him.
@MonzaGT What a frigging nightmare!
@MonzaGT Honestly, you've never seen such chaos as here - or maybe you have. Old houses & their idiosyncratic drainage/sewerage pipe sysrems
@ShakingStick Workmen! A mixed blessing!
Charming! The EQC diggers have broken my water pipes - and the neighbours! Everyone is thrilled.
@CherylBernstein But after not having to buy soap for 18 years, I guess I shouldn't be complaining.
@CherylBernstein I looked in the bathroom cupboard last week and panicked when I counted only 15 hotel soaps left!
@CherylBernstein Does that come with a free notepad?
@CherylBernstein Every time I hear someone say 'Enjoy" I think to myself (without fail), @CherylBernstein wouldn't like that. TwitterLegacy
@Margie186 They're addictive!
@Margie186 Twinlets! How fabulous. They grow incredibly fast. 'My twins' arrive from Australia on Thursday.......they're about to turn 7!
Time to download and edit 294 photos of soap! I think I may have been a little over-excited - if you can believe that.
@JarrodGilbertNZ Go on... test it anyway... you know you want to...
@JarrodGilbertNZ PS I don't think calling them "little fuckers" will help.
@JarrodGilbertNZ Perhaps you need to curl up in their bed - you know...so your body scent is on it - or is that too inappropriate?
